summary: A player house and nearby dungeon/mine for future expansion. House tailored to my needs and style, complete with multiple follower beds, outdoor crafting area, customized mood lighting (RED of course!), basement display area complete with display cases, mannequins and an assortment of items collected by the previous homeowner.
descriptionHtml:
*** WARNING!!!  This mod has NOT yet been confirmed functional in \"Dawnguard DLC\" 
    expansion pack.  I am waiting a while for the dust (and Steam lag) to settle before
    I jump into Dawnguard and whatever Mod update requirements are needed.  Looks
    like we are also waiting for a new Creation Kit upgrade for Dawnguard as well... ***

=========================================================================================
The Red Estate - v1.1 (August 1, 2012)
=========================================================================================

Excerpts from the journal of the former occupant:

 \"Father finally passed away from the sickness that runs rampant in our family.  I wonder 
  when my time will come? ...As the only remaining daughter, I have inherited The Red Estate
  in Skyrim - Father\'s last remaining piece of family property.  I have heard much about 
  it\'s beautiful gardens and ...Father\'s collection room ...\"


=========================================================================================
BACKGROUND
=========================================================================================

A player house mod in western Skyrim, suited to my adventuring playstyle and wishes.  After
using it for a number of weeks and continually tweaking its content, I figured I might as 
well share it with the community that made it all possible!  :)

Travel west from Solitude to Harmugstahl.  From there, head almost directly north towards
Mor Khazgur, and you\'ll run into The Red Estate up the hill after crossing the river that
flows between these two locations.

There\'s the beginnings of a storyline at the estate, with a minor treasure hunt required
to figure out where the key to the house has been stashed.  The key to the nearby mine is
also hidden, but I\'ve intentionally blocked access to most of the mine/dungeon until I\'ve 
finished that area of the mod.  So if you find the key to the mine, keep it safe and stay 
tuned for a future release!

I\'m still figuring out the Creation Kit and all it\'s features, so I don\'t profess this mod
to be anything other than my little creation project for self-enjoyment.  If you like it, 
bonus for you!  Either way, I appreciate the opportunity to share on the Nexus, and look
forward to your feedback.


=========================================================================================
MOD DESCRIPTION & LOCATION
=========================================================================================

A player house and nearby dungeon/mine for future quest expansion.  House tailored to my
needs and playstyle, complete with multiple follower beds, outdoor crafting area (who wants
all that crap cluttering their house and stinking the place up?), customized mood lighting
(duh, red of course!), basement \"display\" area complete with display cases, mannequins and
an assortment of items collected by the previous homeowner.

Cells affected:

|---------|
| -37,19 | < Navmesh minor modifications
|---------|---------|
| -37,18 | -36,18 | < Navmesh minor modifications, some static content
|---------|---------|
| -37,17 | -36,17 | < Heavy customization, navmesh, statics, landscape
|---------|---------|
| -37,16 | -36,16 | < Heavy customization, navmesh, statics, landscape
|---------|---------|
| -37,15 | -36,16 | < Heavy customization, navmesh, statics, landscape
|---------|---------|

* There\'s also a handful of minor static and quest objects placed in -38,16.
  No navmesh or landscape changes in that cell.


** WARNING: Any mods that affect the above cells will likely cause some sort of conflict
            with my mod.  You\'ll have to resolve these by either changing the order of
            which mod loads first (mine or the other one), or more likely choose to only
            use ONE mod that affects any of the above cells.  Don\'t worry, I won\'t be
            offended if you don\'t pick mine. ;)

A partial storyline currently exists with the estate; future expansion will include the
completion of the nearby mine/dungeon area, along with quests and items featured in the
story/journals/books found within.


=========================================================================================
>>>**REQUIRED COMPONENTS YOU MUST ALSO INSTALL BEFORE USING MY MOD**<<<
=========================================================================================

1) ApachiiSkyHair v1.4 or higher 
	Must be above my mod in your load list.  You can find the latest package here on
	SkyrimNexus: http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/10168

2) The Ashen - Oriental Beauty Race
	Must be above my mod in your load list.  Future versions will be introducing NPC
	characters that make use of the Ashen race, and since I have started development
	in the background of the ESP, you *MUST* now install \"The Ashen\" mod before you
	load my latest version 1.0.  In particular, ONE file from \"The Ashen\" mod must
	be loaded above my mod: \"RaceCompatability.esm\", which can be found inside this 
	package on SkyrimNexus: http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/8583

3) Modders resource 1-10 Second Silence 
	Must be above my mod in your load list. Provides me a simple method of including
	truly silent sound tracks to go along with subtitle NPC dialogue in quests.  Mod 
	can be found here on SkyrimNexus: http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/16254

* This mod is not fully voiced. You will need to turn on subtitles to read the text.


=========================================================================================
CURRENT FEATURES
=========================================================================================

v0.9
- Landscaped player home and surrounding area providing a scenic vista of the nearby valley, 
  with abundant hunting nearby, and numerous follower \"idle\" points for any follower you set
  to \"relax\".  
- Exterior garden area, complete with follower \"idle\" points for anyone you set to \"relax\".
* Have tested with UFO and 15 followers (7 inside, 8 outside), and haven\'t run into any 
  issues personally.
- Exterior crafting area including: enchanting table, alchemy table, smelter, tanning rack, 
  anvil, workbench, sharpening wheel, specific storage chests, & generic storage containers;
  all interactable by your followers.
- House 3-floor interior complete with: multiple weapon racks; wall mounted display points; 
  mannequins (21 total); abundant storage; 4 single beds; 1 double bed; multiple follower
  \"idle\" locations; a number of bookshelves; and customized mood lighting. 
- Nearby mine/dungeon area partially completed (exterior entrance and storyline complete,
  but interior of dungeon and accompanying quests and items not yet finished).  Key to the
  mine IS hidden in the house somewhere, but if you DO enter the mine, please be aware it
  is not complete. :)
- Exterior dragon \"perch\" locations encourage some entertaining battles when dragons spawn.

v1.0
- Cooking area with some non-respawning containers are located down the hill by the river
  (hang a left coming out the front door or garden), but be warned that some locals might
  be attempting to enjoy a meal down there too! ;)
- Additional spawning wildlife in the area for those of us to love to hunt!
- Two NPC characters which feature \"ApachiiSkyHair\" and \"The Ashen - Oriental Beauty Race\" 
  are also now included, with more in development for future quests and interactions. 
- **TWO INTRO QUESTS** with the previous home owners, now properly introduce you to the
  estate AND provide you with the key to the house.  I have changed the locks on the front
  doors, so those of you who installed v0.9 might find yourselves locked out of the house
  until after you complete these two quests.  **MORE INFO ON QUESTS BELOW**

*NEW* v1.1
- **TWO INTRO QUESTS REMOVED TEMPORARILY**
  Due to problems with the initial starter quests (that I\'m still figuring out), I have
  completely REMOVED the quests and silent voice files from this version.
- Added another outdoor weapon rack at the back door.
- Fixed some navmesh issues around the crafting area, including collision walls to help
  avoid multiple \"relaxing\" followers from getting stuck inside the building mesh.
- Corrected some minor idle leaning spots outside that had followers leaning into
  walls and posts, instead of ON them.
- Have placed the key to the estate house in the backyard on Kierraen\'s grave (again, 
  just for now until I can get the quests working the way I want them to).
- Have increased the size of the hidden mine key slightly - it *IS* hidden in the house,
  but blends in well with its surroundings (but I promise it\'s not buried!).
  

=========================================================================================
FUTURE PLANS
=========================================================================================

- Will upgrade interior to include a kitchen area, complete with storage and cooking area.
  For now, make use of the cooking pot/fire down by the river.

- Continuing storyline & quest development for the accompanying mine/dungeon area, with 
  eventual full access and (hopefully!) unique reward items.

- Bug fixes and optimizations as they are reported and I figure out how to do them! :)

**BE WARNED: 
	This project is primarily for MY enjoyment, so your suggestions, pains, desires
	or complaints may not always result in changes.  ** Use at your own risk. **


=========================================================================================
WARNING - WARRANTEE NOT INCLUDED
=========================================================================================

Okay - let\'s just all get on the same page here.  I\'m not perfect - well, Canadian, natural
redhead of Scottish origins - so close, but still, NOT perfect.  The things I create, that
WE create as a community, are not perfect either.  Neither is the wonderful Skyrim game from
Bethesda (gasp!).  Our intentions as authors and creators however, is to get as close as we 
can, with the tools and knowledge and skills available to us.  Keep this in mind when using
any content for any game, along with a healthy dose of patience and tollerance, and you\'ll
enjoy the journey a lot more.

I do NOT guarantee my mod or its contents to work on any computer but my own, nor do I 
guarantee its performance or impact on any environment other than what I\'ve got installed 
myself.  I have done my best to ensure it functions as I have advertised in this readme, 
having spent more than 40 hours of development and playtesting time with my mod content. 

I do NOT promise to respond to every bug, every request for enhancement, every comment nor
every email I receive regarding this mod.  I am not intentionally going to ignore them
either, but please realize that I have a life, a full time job, and two wonderful teenage
daughters that keep me busy.  I game and mod for fun, and take the time out of my life when
I can manage.  I will try my best to keep up with comments and bugs, and to the best of my
ability and with what time I have available, I will endeavor to update this mod over time.

I do NOT expect everyone to love this mod.  I made it with myself in mind, and I completely
understand that YOU are not all perfect, Canadian, natural redheads. ;)  I\'ll just go with
an expectation that I will love this mod myself - anyone else that finds joy in it, is 
icing on my cake! :)


=========================================================================================
INSTALL INSTRUCTIONS
=========================================================================================

>>>**REQUIRED COMPONENTS YOU MUST ALSO INSTALL BEFORE USING MY MOD**<<<

1) ApachiiSkyHair v1.4 or higher 
	Must be above my mod in your load list.  You can find the latest package here on
	SkyrimNexus: http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/10168

2) The Ashen - Oriental Beauty Race
	Must be above my mod in your load list.  Future versions will be introducing NPC
	characters that make use of the Ashen race, and since I have started development
	in the background of the ESP, you *MUST* now install \"The Ashen\" mod before you
	load my latest version 1.0.  In particular, ONE file from \"The Ashen\" mod must
	be loaded above my mod: \"RaceCompatability.esm\", which can be found inside this 
	package on SkyrimNexus: http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/8583

3) Modders resource 1-10 Second Silence 
	Must be above my mod in your load list. Provides me a simple method of including
	truly silent sound tracks to go along with subtitle NPC dialogue in quests.  Mod 
	can be found here on SkyrimNexus: http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/16254


>>>**UPGRADING FROM v0.9**<<<

1) BEFORE installing, please visit the estate and REMOVE all items that you have placed in
   the four (4) large urns (2 outside by crafting area, 2 inside down the stairs under the
   dragon\'s head).  These urns have been REPLACED with non-respawning empty urns in v1.0.

2) Exit the estate house, run down the main fenced pathway and KEEP RUNNING until you pass
   the three (3) large, dead, twisty-looking trees that are placed (somewhat) in a line
   extending from the front gate.  You\'ll end up going up a slight hill opposite the front
   gate.  If you get this far away from the house, it should be a safe distance to then 
   *SAVE YOUR GAME* (helps to allow full cell contents to reload with the changes).

3) Close Skyrim.  Extract this archive into your Skyrim\\Data folder, maintaining folder
   structures and *OVERWRITING* any files you are prompted to (with the EXCEPTION of the
   \"Bathing Beauties Luxury Suite\" files mentioned below - don\'t overwrite those).

4) Please install the *REQUIRED COMPONENTS* (listed in at the top of this section).

5) Run Skyrim Launcher, and enter \"DATA FILES\" option, ensuring that this newly added 
   \"sarharien_the_red_estate.esp\" is activated for loading.  (For me personally, I have 
   it loading LAST in my list, and haven\'t run into CTD issues yet!)

6) Restart Skyrim, load your Save Game, and enjoy the changes!
   **RECOMMEND you immediately make a new save game & re-load the new save before playing.**


>>>**UPGRADING FROM v1.0**<<<

1) Exit the estate house, run down the main fenced pathway and KEEP RUNNING until you pass
   the three (3) large, dead, twisty-looking trees that are placed (somewhat) in a line
   extending from the front gate.  You\'ll end up going up a slight hill opposite the front
   gate.  If you get this far away from the house, it should be a safe distance to then 
   *SAVE YOUR GAME* (helps to allow full cell contents to reload with the changes).

2) Close Skyrim.  Extract this archive into your Skyrim\\Data folder, maintaining folder
   structures and *OVERWRITING* any files you are prompted to (with the EXCEPTION of the
   \"Bathing Beauties Luxury Suite\" files mentioned below - don\'t overwrite those).

3) Please install the *REQUIRED COMPONENTS* (listed in at the top of this section).

4) Run Skyrim Launcher, and enter \"DATA FILES\" option, ensuring that this newly added 
   \"sarharien_the_red_estate.esp\" is activated for loading.  (For me personally, I have 
   it loading LAST in my list, and haven\'t run into CTD issues yet!)

5) *DELETE* The following quest related files, as they are removed from this version,
   and will be appropriately renamed and recreated in a future version:
      \\Data\\Sound\\Voice\\sarharien_the_red_estate.esp\\*.*
      \\Data\\Scripts\\Sar_*.pex
      \\Data\\Scripts\\QF_Sar_*.pex
      \\Data\\Scripts\\Source\\Sar_*.psc
      \\Data\\Scripts\\Source\\QF_Sar_*.psc

6) Restart Skyrim, load your Save Game, and enjoy the changes!  
   **RECOMMEND you immediately make a new save game & re-load the new save before playing.**


>>>**NEW INSTALLATIONS**<<<

Manual install recommended, as I don\'t personally use other methods for installation, and
can\'t presently describe or explain non-manual methods.

1) Extract my RAR file into your Skyrim\\Data Folder, maintaining the folder structures.

   NOTE: I use some of the objects and textures from \"Bathing Beauties Luxury Suite\" and
         \"A Classier BB Luxury Suite\", so *IF* you get prompted to overwrite some files, 
         you can just *SKIP* and NOT overwrite them, thus ensuring full BBLS compatability
         with the latest versions those authors have released! :)

2) Please install the *REQUIRED COMPONENTS* (listed in at the top of this section).

3) Run Skyrim Launcher, and enter \"DATA FILES\" option, ensuring that this newly added 
   \"sarharien_the_red_estate.esp\" is activated for loading.  (For me personally, I have 
   it loading LAST in my list, and haven\'t run into CTD issues yet!)

4) Start Skyrim, and enjoy!
   **RECOMMEND you immediately make a new save game & re-load the new save before playing.**


=========================================================================================
TO UNINSTALL (gasp! /sadface)
=========================================================================================

>>MANUAL UNINSTALL<<
1) If you installed it manually, delete this file from your Skyrim\\Data folder: 
   \"sarharien_the_red_estate.esp\". 
 
   a) If you HAVE installed \"Bathing Beauties or Beefcake - Luxury Suite\", then
      skip down to step 1c below.

   b) If you have NOT installed \"Bathing Beauties or Beefcake - Luxury Suite\", then
      please additionally remove the following files I packaged with my mod:
      \\Data\\Meshes\\architecture\\BBLS\\LS_rugE.nif
      \\Data\\Meshes\\architecture\\BBLS\\LS_rugHalfRound.nif
      \\Data\\Meshes\\architecture\\BBLS\\LS_rugRound.nif
      \\Data\\Meshes\\architecture\\BBLS\\LS_wrintchfloorwoodplatfloor01.nif
      \\Data\\Textures\\architecture\\BBLS\\aaRIP88_LS_RugE.dds
      \\Data\\Textures\\architecture\\BBLS\\aaRIP88_LS_rugHalfRound01.dds
      \\Data\\Textures\\architecture\\BBLS\\aaRIP88_LS_ruground01_n.dds	    
      \\Data\\Textures\\architecture\\BBLS\\aaRIP88_LS_ruground02.dds
      \\Data\\Textures\\architecture\\BBLS\\aaRIP88_LS_WoodFloor.dds
      \\Data\\Textures\\architecture\\BBLS\\aaRIP88_LS_WoodFloor_n.dds
      \\Data\\Textures\\architecture\\BBLS\\aaRIP88_LS_WoodFloorStraigh90_n.dds
      \\Data\\Textures\\architecture\\BBLS\\aaRIP88_LS_WoodFloorStraight.dds
      \\Data\\Textures\\architecture\\BBLS\\aaRIP88_LS_WoodFloorStraight_n.dds
      \\Data\\Textures\\architecture\\BBLS\\aaRIP88_LS_WoodFloorStraight90.dds
      \\Data\\Textures\\architecture\\BBLS\\aaRIP88_LS_WoodFloorStraightDark.dds
      \\Data\\Textures\\architecture\\BBLS\\aaRIP88_LS_WoodFloorStraightDark90.dds

   c) Please delete the following additional folders related to my mod:
      \\Data\\Sound\\Voice\\sarharien_the_red_estate.esp\\*.*
      \\Data\\Scripts\\Sar_*.pex
      \\Data\\Scripts\\QF_Sar_*.pex
      \\Data\\Scripts\\Source\\Sar_*.psc
      \\Data\\Scripts\\Source\\QF_Sar_*.psc
      \\Data\\Meshes\\Actors\\Character\\facegendata\\facegeom\\sarharien_the_red_estate.esp\\*.*
      \\Data\\Textures\\Actors\\facegendata\\facetint\\sarharien_the_red_estate.esp\\*.*
      \\Data\\Textures\\Oaristys\\*.*

   d) You\'re done!

>>OTHER INSTALL METHODS<<
2) If you installed with another method, follow that method\'s uninstallation instructions,
   or manually uninstall as noted above.

* Don\'t worry, I won\'t hold it against you - but I do thank you for trying it out anyways!


=========================================================================================
**CURRENTLY REMOVED FROM v1.1** QUESTS & QUEST RELATED KNOWN ISSUES
=========================================================================================

**CURRENTLY REMOVED FROM v1.1**

INTRO QUEST (Q00) - \"The Gastronomic Goblet\"
	At a certain time of day, you can find the previous home owner relaxing out behind
	the house.  Read her journal(s) to discover where and when, and then lend a hand
	recovering her special goblet.
	
QUEST #1 (Q01) - \"Unlocking the Estate\"
	After completing the intro quest, you will be sent off to find the other previous
	home owner, who will provide you with the key to the estate... well, after you help
	her resolve a conflict with a local thief. ;)

	
=========================================================================================
CURRENT KNOWN ISSUES (non-quest related)
=========================================================================================

1) Entrance into the lower part of the mine is presently impossible (unless you \"cheat\" and
   use something like TCL/TFC).  This is BY DESIGN, as I haven\'t finished the complete mine
   and dungeon area, and will be working on that content and quest line next.

2) There\'s a bit of an initial FPS hit when I enter the area, but after a few seconds, it
   settles down on my system and I don\'t notice it anymore (and my system isn\'t amazing).

3) I\'m still figuring out things like lighting and optimizations, so I\'m sure that there are
   a few issues with spiderwebbing, overlapping meshes, and the like, but I believe most 
   of the interior is now fixed.

4) **QUESTS HAVE BEEN REMOVED from v1.1 and will be introduced later when I fix them.**

If you find other issues, be so kind as to post in comments on Skyrim Nexus for this file.
I\'m not a perfect modder - I expect errors to come up for some people.  You don\'t have the
same system as me, nor the same settings, so don\'t expect the same behaviour in all 
circumstances!  :)  Be patient and understanding - I have done my best to avoid problems
while allowing for a clean uninstall.  

\"Patience is not learned in a weekend.\" ~Anon


=========================================================================================
COMPATABILITY TESTED
=========================================================================================

I have personally installed and am using the following mods along with my house mod, and do
not presently suffer from any conflicts or CTDs (I have my mod loading last in my list). In
alphabetical order:

via Skyrim Nexus:
- 83Willows 101BugsHD Butterfly Dragonfly Luna-Moth Torchbug
- A Classier BB Luxury Suite
- ApachiiSkyHair
- Auto Unequip Arrows
- Bandit Raids
- Bathing Beauties or Beefcake - Luxury Suite
- Better Bows
- Better Circlets HQ V1o1
- Cloaks of Skyrim
- Glowing Ore veins 300
- Improved Freckles Skyrim
- JaySuS Swords
- Lanterns of Skyrim - All In One
- Matherian Viking Shields Set - MVSS
- Modders Resource Pack
- Modders Resource-Weapon Racks-Bookshelves-Plaques-Mannequins
- Nicos Craftable Arrows
- RANs Eybrow Replacer 01-08
- RANs Eyeliner Replacer
- See You Sleep by Madmole
- Skyrim HD - 2K Textures
- The Ashen - Oriental Beauty Race
- The Chronicles of Steel - Skyrim- Realswords NEXUS EXCLUSIVE
- The Eyes Of Beauty
- Tribunal robes set
- UFO - Ultimate Follower Overhaul
- Unique Booze Bottles HD
- WATER - Water And Terrain Enhancement Redux
- Wearable Lanterns
* plus numerous add-on armors & follower NPC mods

via Steam Workshop:
- Build Your Own Home
- City Houses Light / Shadows Fix
- Complete Skyforge
- Enhanced High-Level Gameplay
- Isilmeriel\'s LOTR Weapons
- Legible Road Sings High Res
- Mountain Crest
- Open Face Guard Helms
- Realistic Map + Roads !
- Sounds of Skyrim - The Dungeons
- Sounds of Skyrim - The Wilds
- The Cartographers Map Markers
- Vicious Weapon Pack


=========================================================================================
THANKS & CREDITS TO OTHERS (I highly endorse and recommend all mods mentioned below!!!)
=========================================================================================

Thanks to...

- GomuGomu64: For his \"Modders resource 1-10 Second Silence\" package to help modders like
              me in being able to incorporate silent WAV tracks into our NPC speech when
              voice acting is not (presently) an option.  His very helpful mod resource
              can be found here: http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/16254

- apachii: For his \"ApachiiSkyHair\" - an incredible mod giving us amazing new hairstyles
	   for our NPCs!  Highly endorsed - find here: http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/10168

- Seren4xx & RadioRagae: For their \"The Ashen - Oriental Beauty Race\" which I will be using
			 in the development of some future NPC characters in my mod.  You 
			 can grab their mod here: http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/8583

- eldiabs: For his \"Modders Resource-Weapon Racks-Bookshelves-Plaques-Mannequins\" mod. This
                    was an incredibly helpful resource for me in figuring out how to place
                    things like weapon racks and mannequins in a way that didn\'t drive me
                    completely batty.  If you\'re a modder, you will likely appreciate and
                    endorse it too: http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/11618

- Oaristys & Tony67: For their collaborative and exceptional \"Modders Resource Pack\". This
                     mod contains dozens of great static items for inclusion within your own
                     creations - things like chests full of ingots, or neatly stacked 
                     shelves of scrolls, or assortments of dishes and other bling!  Easily
                     incorporated with the use of the Creation Kit.  I have endorsed and 
                     highly recommend this mod: http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/16525

- Matherthebec: For his excellent mod \"Matherian Viking Shields Set\", which adds beautiful
                and lore-realistic shields into Skyrim.  If you haven\'t discovered this fine
                mod and endorsed it, try it now: http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/20217
                At his request, I am also mentioning his MEDIEVAL TOTAL WAR COMMUNITY which
                can be found here: http://mtwitalia.freeforumzone.leonardo.it/

- howiego08: For his incredible \"Better Bows\" mod, which inspired me to incorporate a little
             storyline and eventual future quest featuring a special heirloom bow left 
             behind by the previous homeowner.  I have endorsed and highly recommend his
             entire line of bows found here: http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/13317

- Migal130: For his Bathing Beauties Luxury Suite.  A great mod which I enjoyed examining
            within the CK in order to learn various aspects of modding.  Highly recommend
            and have personally endorsed his file: http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/11427

- rip88: For his great re-textures of wood flooring and carpets for the BBLS, which I make 
         use of in my home.  Please try his file: http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/19866  
         I endorsed him, and once you\'ve seen his work, you will too!

- Numerous fellow modders who have posted on Skyrim Nexus: Thanks to this incredible
  community of helpful, talkative, descriptive and talented people, people like me have a 
  chance to create something wonderful in a game we all love. *THANK YOU*

- Everyone willing to try out my mod, even if you don\'t like it.  Feedback is appreciated!

- dr4cos: For your great feedback and bug reporting of v0.9.  Thanks!

- Skyrim Nexus, for their website and services hosting our mods. Happily a premium member!

- Bethesda, for their great game, Skyrim.

- All my peeps back on Dwarrowdelf in that \"other\" game, who are patiently awaiting my
  return while I craft and completed this first release version of my mod.  Sar the Red
  will be back soon!

* My apologies if I have forgotten to mention anyone who has unknowingly contributed to my
  mod through your own impressive material.  I have tried to carefully keep track of all
  those individuals whom I have gleaned information and knowledge from (and occasionally
  your wonderful content), but know I might be missing some people.  Sorry! xoxo


=========================================================================================
PERMISSIONS
=========================================================================================

- eldiabs: \"Hope it saves a few modders time.\" <<-- Understatement of the year! ;)

- Oaristys: \"You are free to use these resources in your own mods without asking as long as 
             you give me proper credits.\"

- Matherthebec: \"Please, feel free to use that set for any mod or armor pack you like, JUST 
                 QUOTE ME AND MY MEDIEVAL TOTAL WAR COMMUNITY IN CREDITS.\"
 
- Migal130: \"You are welcome to explore it to try to figure out how I\'ve done things.\"

- rip88: \"Anyone is free to use anything that I have made, However, most of my work is based 
          in some way off a stock Bethesda mesh or texture, so keep it in this game please.\"


=========================================================================================
VERSION RELEASE HISTORY
=========================================================================================
v1.1 - (2012-Aug-01) Update released, removing the buggy intro quests until I can figure
                     out how to correctly display dialogue and quest objectives in a 
                     consistent voiced & non-voiced manner.
                        - Removed blank voice files and script files to save space.
			- Updated readme with special instructions for upgrading from 1.0.
			- Added a weapon rack outside the other door of the house.
			- Added the key to the estate house on Kierraen\'s grave out back.
			- Increased size of the hidden mine key in the house.
			- Updated navmesh around crafting area to prevent stuck followers.
			- Removed quest NPCs.

v1.0 - (2012-Jul-25) Update released, with two intro quests complete that \"unlock\" the 
                     estate house, and provide some initial introduction to the main
                     characters.  The following changes and updates were also included:
			- Four (4) large urns (2 inside downstairs, 2 outside by crafting)
			  have been *REPLACED* with non-spawning large urns. Prior version
			  users should first REMOVE items placed in those urns BEFORE you
			  install to v1.0.  I am hoping this is the last of the respawning
			  containers accidentally put into the house.  Sorry!
			- Outdoor cooking spot with non-spawning containers has been created
			  down by the river (left out the front garden gate).  Watch for
			  locals who might like using the spot too!
			- Navmeshes in the basement \"collection room\" have been corrected
			  to avoid followers getting stuck.
			- A number of cosmetic changes to the \"collection room\" in the
			  basement.  New clutter, new containers, new wall mounted shield
			  racks on a number of pillars and walls for you to decorate in
			  your preferred style (P.S. highly recommend \"MATHERIAN VIKING
			  SHIELD SET\" http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/20217 for decor!)
			- Some minor changes and updates inside the house related to 
			  texture gaps and incorrectly positioned pillars.  Hopefully 
			  the visual issues are gone!
			- Removed some of the banners and lights heading up the main path
			  to help improve FPS outside.
			- Added a bunch of static and quest content outside (mostly back
			  behind the house and down by the river).  You\'ll have to explore!
			* Main estate house is now *LOCKED* with a new key that is received
			  after completing the two intro quests (see QUEST section above).

v0.9 - (2012-Jul-20) First public release posted to Skyrim Nexus.  Not entirely complete, 
                     but functional enough to use.  Let the user feedback begin!


=========================================================================================
CHANGELOG
=========================================================================================
0.9
First public release posted to SkyrimNexus.  Not entirely complete but functional enough to use.

1.0
Two intro quests added that \"unlock\" the estate house, and provide initial intro to main characters.
Four (4) large urns replaced (2 inside house, 2 outside in crafting area) with non-spawning versions.
Outdoor cooking spot with non-spawning containers added down by the river.
Navmeshes in basement \"collection room\" have been corrected to avoid stuck followers.
Added some static and quest content outside (mostly back behind the house).  Go explore!

1.1
Removed (temporarily) the intro quests that were causing people problems.  Will fix later.
Added another weapon rack outside other door of house.
Put the key to the house on the grave out back near the garden.
Minor navmesh fixes around the crafting area to prevent stuck followers.

=========================================================================================
end of file
<3 Sar
author: Sarharien

files.name: The_Red_Estate_by_Sarharien_v1-1
files.changelogHtml:
Removed (temporarily) the intro quests that were causing people problems. Will fix later.
Added another weapon rack outside other door of house.
Put the key to the house on the grave out back near the garden.
Minor navmesh fixes around the crafting area to prevent stuck followers.
Quest NPCs removed temporarily.
Fully functional kitchen with non-spawning storage now inside the house!
*** WARNING!!! This mod has NOT yet been confirmed functional in \"Dawnguard DLC\"
